nodes.bodyText:
I wonder if this should actually be called AbstractST
To match with the naming conventions we've gone elsewhere in Strimzi, i.e. AbstractModel
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -510,7 +510,7 @@ protected void checkReadinessLivenessProbe(String podNamePrefix, String containe
         }

nodes.bodyText: Maybe we could use verifyLabelsOnPods and remove verifyLabelsForKafkaOrZkPodscompletely, because its do bsically the same thing

Not sure about the package components , I'm not sure that the previous structure wasn't right (for atleast this set of tests) - what is the components package doing here?
Aren't all the STs basically testing components?
Yes that's true. I was just thinking to separate it somehow from other because tests in bridge focus mostly on the functionality of Bridge for example
I do like that you've put this in the kafka package, but I think that components here is just redundant...
Ye, that sounds reasonable to me

I wonder if all the namespace tests should go in a package like watcher
i.e. io.strimzi.systemtest.watcher.AllNamespaceST
io.strimzi.systemtest.watcher.MultipleNamespaceST
The package being the intent/theme of all the tests and then the class being more specific
Surely this is part of the operators package
So maybe both classes from recovery put into operators.cluster ?
Security seems fine here, as a package name, as security is a pretty big topic and is mostly about ensuring you have no gaps and everything is correctly configured/encrypted etc
Perhaps this should be infrastructure or deployment or install
I think we will remove this class soon. I want to do same thing as I did with OLM installation - add a posibility to run most of the tests against CO installed via helm
